messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Sure—just to make sure I pull the correct information, could you tell me what date you mean by “yesterday” (and, if relevant, your time zone)?
I don't know the exact date! 😅
No problem—just one more detail: which time zone are you in (e.g., “US Eastern,” “UTC+1,” etc.)? That way I can figure out exactly what counts as “yesterday” for you and pull the right reminders.
I'm not sure right now, sorry!

No worries at all! To figure out what “yesterday” means for you, I just need a rough idea of your current time zone. The easiest ways are:

• Let me know your city / region (e.g., “Berlin,” “California,” “India”), or  
• Tell me roughly what time it is for you right now (e.g., “about 3 p.m.”).

Either one will give me enough to determine yesterday’s date and pull your reminders.
I don't actually have that info handy. Can we check without it?

I totally understand the convenience of just saying “yesterday,” but to pull the right reminders I need at least one anchor—otherwise I can’t tell which calendar day to search.

Any one of these would do the trick:
• Today’s date where you are (e.g., “April 6”)  
• Roughly what time it is for you now (e.g., “about 3 p.m.”)  
• Your city, region, or time-zone name (e.g., “San Francisco,” “IST,” “UTC-5”)

Could you share whichever of those is easiest for you?
